thread.title: Organic Food Market to Reach USD 566.11 Billion by 2030, Growing
thread.title_full: Organic Food Market to Reach USD 566.11 Billion by 2030, Growing

author: MAXIMIZE MARKET RESEARCH PVT. LTD.
title: Organic Food Market to Reach USD 566.11 Billion by 2030, Growing
text:
Organic Food Market to Reach USD 566.11 Billion by 2030, Growing at a Robust CAGR of 13.7 Percentage 01-10-2025 07:28 AM CET | Advertising, Media Consulting, Marketing Research
Press release from: MAXIMIZE MARKET RESEARCH PVT. LTD. Organic Food Market
ðŽð«ð ðšð§ð¢ðœ ð…ð¨ð¨ð ðŒðšð«ð¤ðžð­ size was valued at USD 230.45 Bn in 2023 and is expected to reach USD 566.11 Bn by 2030, at a CAGR of 13.7 %.
ðŽð«ð ðšð§ð¢ðœ ð…ð¨ð¨ð ðŒðšð«ð¤ðžð­ ðŽð¯ðžð«ð¯ð¢ðžð°:
The organic food market has witnessed exponential growth in recent years, driven by a rising global demand for healthier and environmentally sustainable food options. Organic food refers to products cultivated without synthetic fertilizers, pesticides, genetically modified organisms (GMOs), or artificial additives. Consumers' increasing awareness of health benefits, coupled with concerns about food safety and environmental sustainability, has significantly propelled the demand for organic produce, dairy, meat, and packaged goods. Furthermore, stringent government regulations and certifications ensuring the authenticity of organic food have enhanced consumer trust. The global organic food market was valued at USD 220 billion in 2023 and is projected to grow to USD 450 billion by 2030, registering a robust CAGR of 10.5% during the forecast period. With the expansion of e-commerce platforms and organic specialty stores, accessibility to organic products has improved, further boosting market growth. The sector is also witnessing increasing investments in organic farming technologies, aiming to meet the growing consumer demand sustainably.

ðƒð«ð¢ð¯ðžð«ð¬ ð¢ð§ ð­ð¡ðž ðŽð«ð ðšð§ð¢ðœ ð…ð¨ð¨ð ðŒðšð«ð¤ðžð­:
Emerging trends in the organic food market reflect a shift toward innovation and diversification to cater to evolving consumer preferences. One notable trend is the rise of plant-based organic products, driven by the growing popularity of veganism and vegetarianism. Organic snacks and convenience foods are also gaining traction, catering to busy lifestyles while maintaining health priorities. Technological advancements in organic farming, such as precision agriculture and vertical farming, are optimizing production efficiency and sustainability. The market is also seeing increased consumer demand for transparency, prompting brands to invest in traceability and blockchain technologies to ensure authenticity. Another significant trend is the expansion of private-label organic products by retail giants, making organic food more affordable and accessible. Furthermore, the demand for organic beverages, including organic teas, coffees, and juices, is on the rise. These trends underscore the organic food market's dynamic nature, paving the way for sustainable growth and innovation in the coming years.

Vietnam's organic food market is expanding rapidly, driven by rising consumer demand for chemical-free produce and government initiatives promoting organic farming. Recent partnerships between VinEco and international distributors have enhanced the availability of organic products in the domestic and export markets. The growing middle class in Vietnam is further fueling demand for premium organic foods, creating significant growth opportunities.
ðŽð«ð ðšð§ð¢ðœ ð…ð¨ð¨ð ð“ð«ðžð§ðð¬ ð¢ð§ ð“ð¡ðšð¢ð¥ðšð§ð
Thailand is embracing organic food trends, with increasing investments in organic rice and tropical fruit production. Collaborations such as CP Group's strategic partnerships with local organic farmers have strengthened the supply chain. The government's "Organic Agriculture Development Strategy" is a pivotal driver, encouraging sustainable farming practices and exports.
ðŽð©ð©ð¨ð«ð­ð®ð§ð¢ð­ð¢ðžð¬ ð¢ð§ ð‰ðšð©ðšð§
Japan's organic food market is witnessing growth due to heightened consumer interest in health and wellness. The "Farm to Fork" initiatives, backed by organizations like Aeon Co., Ltd., have boosted organic product accessibility. Japan's stringent labeling and certification laws further ensure high-quality organic food production, supporting market expansion.
ð‚ð¨ð§ð¬ð¨ð¥ð¢ððšð­ð¢ð¨ð§ ð¢ð§ ð’ð¨ð®ð­ð¡ ðŠð¨ð«ðžðš
South Korea's organic food sector is undergoing consolidation as large companies such as Pulmuone acquire smaller organic brands to expand their product portfolios. This trend is coupled with a surge in demand for organic baby food and dairy products, driven by urbanization and higher disposable incomes. Government support for eco-friendly farming practices has also strengthened the market.
ð”ð©ððšð­ð¢ð¨ð§ ð¢ð§ ð’ð¢ð§ð ðšð©ð¨ð«ðž
Singapore is updating its organic food industry standards to cater to increasing demand for high-quality, chemical-free produce. Retail chains like FairPrice and Cold Storage are collaborating with global suppliers to bring diverse organic options to consumers. Innovative urban farming initiatives, including vertical farming, are enhancing local organic production.
ð†ð«ð¨ð°ð­ð¡ ð¢ð§ ð­ð¡ðž ð”ð’
The United States leads the global organic food market, driven by federal initiatives such as the USDA Organic Program. Recent mergers like Amazon's acquisition of Whole Foods Market highlight the increasing focus on organic food retail. The rise of plant-based organic products and expanding e-commerce channels are key contributors to market growth.
ðŽð©ð©ð¨ð«ð­ð®ð§ð¢ð­ð¢ðžð¬ ð¢ð§ ð„ð®ð«ð¨ð©ðž
Europe remains a key player in the organic food market, supported by stringent EU regulations and consumer demand for sustainable products. Germany and France are leading in organic food sales, with significant investments from companies like Danone and NestlÃ©. The "Farm to Fork Strategy" is driving innovation and sustainability in the sector, solidifying Europe's position in the global market.
